channel.title: Java 5 on Chao Yang
channel.description: Recent content in Java 5 on Chao Yang

item.title: Enumeration types
item.description: enum’s underlying implementation Define enumerated types by using enum keyword. enum MetaColor { RED, YELLOW, BLUE } Now, MetaColor class has three final static members all of which are of MetaColor class: RED, YELLOW and BLUE MetaColor has 2 static methods: values(), valueOf(..) and other instance methods: name(), ordinal() and toString(), hashCode(), equals(). You can override the toString(), but hashCode() and equals() are final which cannot be override. Actually, enum maintains a singleton for ever enum object, so overriding hashCode() and equals() is not required.
